alert.note: Alert for Ashland; Iron (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 4:31PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Iron and central Ashland Counties through 500 PM CDT... At 430 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Gurney, or 16 miles west of Ironwood, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 30 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Saxon around 435 PM CDT. Upson around 445 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Hurley and Gile. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive through flood waters.
